attributes.action: introduce an on-the-spot fine which ALL 999 crews can issue to time-wasters and hoaxers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Our Police Service currently fines people £80 for Wasting Police Time, so why should our paramedics and fire officers not be able to do the same?

I am currently reading "A Paramedic's Diary: Life & Death on the Streets," by Stuart Gray, published by Monday Books, copyright 2007, in which there are som examples of duff calls received on 999 to ambulance, and below are some quotations (from pages 4 and 5 of the book):

"A model who called... when she broke her finger nail."

"A 31 year old female who dialled 999 because her remote control was out of reach."

"...a call from a 22 year old female who'd squeezed a spot which was now bleeding."

"Some nutter who called... to ask a crew to come out to help wrap Christmas presents."

On Avon and Somerset Police's website, you can listen to some recorded calls to Police on 999 that have been time wasters. And almost daily, we hear of cases where fire engines have been called out to rabbit warren estates and cul-de-sacs only to be pelted with rubble.

This is completely out of order. At the end of the day, genuine cases are losing out, and lives are being lost because of people who do not think before pressing the number 9 three times.
